intro: Staehelina gnaphaloides, commonly known as the silverleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and yellow-orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are composite, consisting of both ray and disk florets, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Staehelina gnaphaloides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought-resistant properties.
